Your Life at Barley Snyder

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Vel ultrices auctor sed lorem augue. Placerat ultrices eget amet gravida. Tellus lacus dolor.

Imagine your ideal law firm

We encourage our associates to assume direct responsibility for substantive client matters at an early stage in their legal careers, emphasizing professional development and mentoring to help establish and develop the skills associates need to manage the legal demands of our local, regional and national clients.

Emma Rose Boyle

hired as an Associate in January 2018 after completing an Internship in 2017

From the very beginning I knew Barley Snyder was a fantastic place to work. I started as a Summer Associate here and could not be happier with my first couple years as a practicing attorney. The talented people I work with, the environment we work in, and the sophistication of work we do here at Barley Snyder are unrivaled in central Pennsylvania, and I cannot imagine working anywhere else.

Emma Rose Boyle

Professional Development Programs

Associate Training Bank

Barley Snyder's Training Bank is a unique program that enables associates to devote a considerable amount of time to training and mentoring activities within the framework of our billable hours expectations. Our training bank program gives associates maximum exposure to useful training opportunities, including attendance and participation at hearings, depositions and transactional activities. Training bank hours are considered billable hours and count toward an associate's annual billable hour goals. The program is designed to maximize the benefits of the mentoring and training with a partner at the firm. Attorneys use training bank hours to expand their knowledge, look for new opportunities and experiences in a variety of legal areas and work with a broader array of attorneys in the firm.

Work Life Benefits

Employee Assistance Program

The firm offers a program to provide employees and their family members with assistance for any personal or family problem. Services are available by appointment at confidential facilities within our region.

Parking

Free parking is provided by the firm at all offices.

Paid Holidays

The firm has 10 paid holidays per calendar year.

Community Service

The firm highly encourages community involvement from our attorneys, especially in leadership roles and nonprofit organizations throughout our footprint. The firm allots a large pool of resources each year to help those nonprofit organizations our attorneys are involved with advance their charitable efforts.

Paid Time Off

Our lawyers are treated as professionals and, as such, the firm does not track your vacation time. The firm also encourages attorneys to utilize this time to ensure a balance between work and family.

Family Leave Time

Associates can receive up to 12 weeks of paid caregiver time for the birth or adoption of a child or placement of a foster child. This time does not have an impact on bonus or partnership consideration. To see an extended explanation of the family leave time policies, click here.

Cell Phone Reimbursement

Attorneys are eligible for up to $100 off the purchase price of one mobile device. The firm will reimburse an attorney up to $110 per month for mobile device usage for their primary device.

BarleyFit

Health and wellness is a priority at the firm and that includes weekly produce delivery at each office, an annual health fair, quarterly fitness competitions and free, voluntary biometric screenings for all employees.

Insurance & Retirement Plans

  • Medical Coverage
  • Health Savings Account
  • Long-Term Disability Insurance
  • Short-Term Disability Insurance
  • Life Insurance
  • Dental insurance
  • 401(k) and Profit Sharing Plans
  • Dependent Care Spending Account
